what is blockchain: Blockchain is a cryptographically secure, open, distributed ledger. A distributed public ledger is a database that is stored and updated independently by each node in the blockchain.
what is bitcoin: Bitcoin is a digital currency which is used to send and receive money across the world in a decentralized manner with minimum transfer fee.
what is a block in blockchain: Blocks are immutable records secured using cryptography.Block is a record book which contains the details of transaction data. A block consists of 4 details: 1.Hash of the previous block 2.Transaction Data 3.Nonce 4.Hash
what are the types of blockchain: There are four types of blockchain: 1.Public Blockchain 2. Private Blockchain 3.Consortium Blockchain 4.Hybrid Blockchain
what is a hash function: Hash function coverts data of arbitrary length to a fixed length. This process is referred to as hashing the data. The hash is much smaller than the input data, hence hash functions are sometimes called compression functions.
what is proof of work: Proof of Work is the process to determine a number (Nonce) along with a cryptographic hash algorithm to produce a hash value lower than a predefined target.
what is public blockchain: A public blockchain is a non-restrictive, permission-less distributed ledger system. The most basic use of public blockchains is for mining and exchanging cryptocurrencies. Example: Bitcoin
what is private blokchain: A private blockchain is a restrictive or permission blockchain operative only in a closed network.Private blockchain networks are deployed for voting, supply chain management, digital identity, asset ownership, etc. Example: Corda
what is consortium blockchain: A consortium blockchain is a semi-decentralized type where more than one organization manages a blockchain network.Consortium blockchains are typically used by banks, government organizations, etc. Example: Energy Web Foundation
what is hybrid blockchain: A hybrid blockchain is a combination of the private and public blockchain. It uses the features of both types of blockchains that is one can have a private permission-based system as well as a public permission-less system. Example: Dragonchain
